snippet: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy has said he will sign a measure approved by the legislature to make Connecticut the 17th state to abolish capital punishment.
abstract: Connecticut House of Representatives votes to repeal the state's death penalty, following a similar vote in the State Senate; Gov Dannel P Malloy has said he will sign the measure, which will make Connecticut the 17th state to abolish capital punishment for future cases.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Dannel P. Malloy has said he will sign a measure approved by the legislature to make Connecticut the 17th state to abolish capital punishment.

headline.seo: Connecticut House Votes to Repeal Death Penalty
headline.main: Death Penalty Repeal Goes to Connecticut Governor
headline.print_headline: Bill to Repeal Death Penalty In Connecticut Goes to Malloy
